column4: Hi- mounting question..... if I'm adding a secondary disk to a server (and logging in as a "user") how do I give every user r/w access to the mounted disk?
is there a wiki for that somewhere/
it answers your question; you asked if there is a wiki somewhere.
/etc/fstab and then you can chmod the mount point I think
I have it in /etc/fstab (I wish there was a disk utility like there is in WIndows (please don't shoot me) )
that will give *everyone* r/w and execute privs on that disk
or at least in the root dir
it won't show up in nautilus (AFAIK) unless it is mounted automatically, maybe someone in here knows how to fix that
I added it to /etc/fstab to auto-mount... I got it now
Thanks... things worked out in the end, w00t
